intro: Machaerium tortipes, commonly known as the zigzag grass, is a tropical plant native to regions of South America. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and often nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features a slender, erect stem with whorled arrangements of leaflets, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, often in dense spikes, and can range in color from white to pink. Machaerium tortipes is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various soil types.
